description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/5168634053 at Tue Sep 26 15:43:50 UTC 2023

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: search Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: search Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: elasticsearch_indexing SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all document indexing requests on GitLab.com, as measured from ElasticSearch.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Elasticsearch logs](https://00a4ef3362214c44a044feaa539b4686.us-central1.gcp.cloud.es.io:9243/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(elasticsearch.component,event.dataset,message),filters:!((meta:(index:'3fdde960-1f73-11eb-9ead-c594f004ece2',key:service.name,params:'prod-gitlab-com+indexing-20200330',type:phrase),query:(match:(service.name:(query:'prod-gitlab-com+indexing-20200330',type:phrase))))),index:'3fdde960-1f73-11eb-9ead-c594f004ece2')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: elasticsearch_searching SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Aggregation of all search queries on GitLab.com, as measured from ElasticSearch.



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Elasticsearch logs](https://00a4ef3362214c44a044feaa539b4686.us-central1.gcp.cloud.es.io:9243/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(elasticsearch.component,event.dataset,message),filters:!((meta:(index:'3fdde960-1f73-11eb-9ead-c594f004ece2',key:service.name,params:'prod-gitlab-com+indexing-20200330',type:phrase),query:(match:(service.name:(query:'prod-gitlab-com+indexing-20200330',type:phrase))))),index:'3fdde960-1f73-11eb-9ead-c594f004ece2')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))

panels.title: global_search_indexing SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="global_search_indexing",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="global_search_indexing",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="global_search_indexing",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="global_search_indexing",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="global_search_indexing",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="global_search_indexing",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="global_search_indexing",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="global_search_indexing",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="search"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="global_search_indexing",monitor="global",type="search"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: global_search_indexing SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

The number of Global Search indexing calls meeting their duration target based on the 99.95th percentile of
indexing. This indicates the duration between when an item was changed and when it became available in Elasticsearch.

This indexing duration is measured in the Sidekiq job triggering the indexing in ElasticSearch.

The target duration can be found here:
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/ee/lib/gitlab/metrics/global_search_indexing_slis.rb#L14-L15
panels.title: Details
Apdex attribution for global_search_indexing Latency - per document_type

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_process_cpu_percent{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[1m]) / 100
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, host) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, host) (
        (elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"} - elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"})
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, host) (
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization Overall

panels.description:
JVM heap memory utilization per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_used_bytes{area="heap", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      /
      elasticsearch_jvm_memory_max_bytes{area="heap", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_jvm_heap_memory component saturation: JVM Heap Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling. The metrics are coming from elasticsearch_exporter.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg_over_time(elasticsearch_process_cpu_percent{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[5m]) / 100
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        (
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
          -
          elasticsearch_filesystem_data_free_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
        )
        /
        elasticsearch_filesystem_data_size_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_single_node_disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Utilization of each thread pool on each node.

Descriptions of the threadpool types can be found at
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-threadpool.html.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, name, exported_type) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_active_count{exported_type!="snapshot", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[5m])
        /
        (avg_over_time(elasticsearch_thread_pool_threads_count{exported_type!="snapshot", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="search"}[5m]) > 0)
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: elastic_thread_pools component saturation: Thread pool utilization

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
